channel.title: ssh on ANDREFFS
channel.description: Recent content in ssh on ANDREFFS

item.title: Docker + PostgreSQL
item.author: andreffs18@gmail.com (André Silva)
item.description: More often than not, I end up going online to look up on how to use docker as the middle man on interacting with Postgres. Usually for me its Postgres, but this “recipe” can be applied to any piece of software that has more than one version which you don’t have installed on your laptop. Because of this whole back and forth I compiled a small list of “how-tos” to help me remember.

item.title: SSH ForwardAgent Gotchas
item.author: andreffs18@gmail.com (André Silva)
item.description: So, you’re trying to create an SSH Tunnel to your remote machine to make some gitlab/github clones. That’s all fine and well until you don’t want to post your password on to the terminal. First, look at you ~/.ssh/config file and add the “ForwardAgent yes” to that machines ip. 1 2 3 Host 35.241.133.24 IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_rsa ForwardAgent yes That says to use your local private key as identification when accessing gitlab on your remote’s machine.
